snippet: A new book argues that the great strides in American innovation and prosperity made from 1920 through 1970 are unlikely to be repeated.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column calls attention to Robert J Gordon book The Rise and Fall of American Growth, which makes pessimistic case that technological progress has slowed and that living standard of youth today will not double that of their parents; notes book argues that while progress and prosperity may accrue to select few, rest will be left behind, which will have political and economic consequences.
lead_paragraph: A new book argues that the great strides in American innovation and prosperity made from 1920 through 1970 are unlikely to be repeated.

headline.print_headline: The Debate on Where America’s Best Days Lie
headline.main: America’s Best Days May Be Behind It

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: The Rise and Fall of American Growth (Book)
